egg1.description: An unhatched egg:  nature's finest blank canvas.
egg1.title: Egg 1

egg2.description:
There's no store-bought easter egg kits in this household. No sir. We use Lucie's watercolors, real paintbrushes, and actual egg holders.

Felix was doing a great job painting until he broke one and we told him we can't fix a broken egg. He was a little down after that, and just watched us paint them.
egg2.title: Egg 2

egg3.description: Guess what happens when you chew on a paintbrush?
egg3.title: Egg 3

jucraig1.description: We went to Julie and Craig's for Easter brunch.  Julie put out plastic eggs for Felix to find.   Felix was ecstatic:  finally, a type of egg that he could break and fix!
jucraig1.title: Jucraig 1

jucraig3.description: Julie's dad is caught by a seasoned sock fisherman.
jucraig3.title: Jucraig 3

jucraig4.description: Felix contemplates the Heffenflopper.  The Heffenflopper, who has demented candy eyes, is a present from the Joyces, who also gave us one last year.  Last year we accidentally melted him into a puddle of chocolate in the trunk of our car.
jucraig4.title: Jucraig 4

park1.description: After Easter brunch we race strollers to the park.  What are we going to see?
park1.title: Park 1

park3.description: Everybody wears their best Sunday dress to an Easter party.
park3.title: Park 3

park4.description: Felix isn't so sure about the giant bunny and her flower girl.
park4.title: Park 4

park5.description: Felix's had a long morning, but he manages to catch Mike's hand before slipping off to sleep.
park5.title: Park 5

description:
The weekend was spent doing pleasant Eastery things. Felix didn't really understand any of the holiday, or the connection between bunnies and eggs, but he caught on to egg painting and egg finding real quick.

We made an offer on a house in Berkeley. It was accepted. Assuming nothing goes wrong, we'll be moving in three or four weeks. It's a great house in a great neighborhood. See the new house pictures.

We've already started looking for daycare/preschool in the East Bay. We visited one place with Felix, who had a great time. Didn't want to leave, in fact. But once we got him back in the car we asked him if he had liked it, and he said, "Nooo! Want stay Sylvie!" The kid really gets what's going on.

Need some artwork for your corporate headquarters? Check out these Dean and Lucie handcrafted originals.
title: April 11
